SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

eu.infomas.dropbox
Class Dropbox

java.lang.Object
  eu.infomas.dropbox.Dropbox

public final class Dropbox
extends Object

DropBox offers an easy-to-use "fluent" interface for working with the Dropbox REST API v1. All operations (REST Requests) are done via this facade API.

Dropbox does use the OAuth 1.0 Protocol which is also supported by this class.

The actual HTTP communication is delegated to a RestClient implementation, which can easily use a different implementation than the default provided by using the Java service-provider loading facility.

NOTE that this class is not thread-safe! Dropbox instances are cheap to create, so do not cache these instances, just create a new instance when needed, use it and throw it away!

Since:
infomas-asl 3.0.2
Author:
Ronald K. Muller

LANGUAGE_KEY

public static final String LANGUAGE_KEY
The name (key) of the property, stored in the Properties file, for the language used by the request. If not specified, the default language "en" (English) is used.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

Dropbox

public Dropbox(Credentials clientCredentials,
               Credentials tokenCredentials)
Create a new Dropbox instance. This is a low level interface, in practice you mostly will use Dropbox(String) or Dropbox(Properties).

Parameters:
clientCredentials - The client (application) credentials. Mandatory.
tokenCredentials - The token (access or request) credentials, may be null in which case the token credentials must be requested by using requestTemporaryCredentials()

Dropbox

public Dropbox(Properties configuration)
Create a new Dropbox instance, using the configuration data supplied by the Properties object. The following property names are recognized:
  • CLIENT_CREDENTIALS_KEY
  • CLIENT_CREDENTIALS_SECRET
  • TOKEN_CREDENTIALS_KEY
  • TOKEN_CREDENTIALS_SECRET
  • LANGUAGE_KEY

Dropbox

public Dropbox(String configurationPath)
        throws IOException
Create a new Dropbox instance, using the configuration data supplied by the Properties file found at the specified location.

Parameters:
configurationPath - The path where the configuration Properties file can be found. If a relative 'configurationPath' is specified, the configuration is loaded relative to the current user (user.dir) directory. If the path starts with "~/" the configuration file is loaded relative to the current user home (user.home) directory. If the prefix classpath: is used, the 'configurationPath' is loaded from the class path. May not be empty or null.
Throws:
IOException
See Also:
Dropbox(java.util.Properties)
Method Detail

withLocale

public Dropbox withLocale(Locale locale)
Configure the language to use when the service endpoints are called. Default value is Locale.ENGLISH.

getLocale

public Locale getLocale()
Return the configured Locale.

setClientCredentials

public void setClientCredentials(Credentials tokenCredentials)
After a Dropbox client is created, you are able to set the request or token Credentials once. These Credentials are returned by requestTokenCredentials(eu.infomas.dropbox.Credentials).

requestTemporaryCredentials

public Credentials requestTemporaryCredentials()
                                        throws IOException
First step in the OAuth 1.0 protocol: Temporary Credentials Request. In this request the client credentials are used which must be provided by Dropbox to this application in advance.

Returns:
Temporary Credentials
Throws:
IOException

getResourceOwnerAuthorizationEndpoint

public URL getResourceOwnerAuthorizationEndpoint(Credentials temporaryCredentials)
                                          throws IOException
Second step in the OAuth 1.0 protocol: Resource Owner Authorization Request. Redirect the Resource Owner (User) to the endpoint returned by this method. If the Resource Owner approved the access to the resource(s), the Token Credentials can be requested by requestTokenCredentials(eu.infomas.dropbox.Credentials).

Parameters:
temporaryCredentials - The Temporary Credentials as returned by requestTemporaryCredentials()
Returns:
The endpoint URI for the Resource Owner Authorization Request
Throws:
IOException

requestTokenCredentials

public Credentials requestTokenCredentials(Credentials temporaryCredentials)
                                    throws IOException
Third step in the OAuth 1.0 protocol: Token Credentials Request.

Parameters:
temporaryCredentials - The Temporary Credentials as returned by requestTemporaryCredentials()
Returns:
The Token Credentials which can be used to access the restricted resources of the Resource Owner
Throws:
IOException

accountInfo

public Account accountInfo()
                    throws IOException
Retrieves information about the user's account.

This method wraps the /account/info service. See the official API Documentation for more information.

Throws:
IOException

filesGet

public Dropbox.FilesGet filesGet(String path)
                          throws IOException
Download a file.

This method wraps the /files (GET) service. See the official API Documentation for more information.

Example Usage: 

 dropbox.filesGet("path")
     .withRange(0, 64)
     .toFile("local path to file");

Returns:
A builder object to customize the request
Throws:
IOException

filesPut

public Dropbox.FilesPut filesPut(String path)
                          throws IOException
Uploads a file using PUT semantics.

This method wraps the /files_put service. See the official API Documentation for more information.

Note that this API does not support the files-POST service. Maximum file size limit is 150 MB.

Returns:
A builder object to customize the request
Throws:
IOException

metadata

public Dropbox.Metadata metadata(String path)
                          throws IOException
Retrieves file and folder metadata.

This method wraps the /metadata service. See the official API Documentation for more information.

Returns:
A builder object to customize the request
Throws:
IOException

delta

public DeltaPage delta(String cursor)
                throws IOException
Return a list of "delta entries", which are instructions on how to update your local state to match the server's state.

This method wraps the /delta service. See the official API Documentation for more information.

Parameters:
cursor - On the first call, you should pass in null. On subsequent calls, pass in the cursor returned by the previous call
Throws:
IOException

revisions

public List<Entry> revisions(String path,
                             int limit)
                      throws IOException
Obtains metadata for the previous revisions of a file.

This method wraps the /revisions service. See the official API Documentation for more information.

Parameters:
path - On the first call, you should pass in null. On subsequent calls, pass in the cursor returned by the previous call
limit - rev_limit Default is 10. Max is 1,000. When listing a file, the service will not report listings containing more than the amount specified and will instead respond with a 406 (Not Acceptable) status response.
Throws:
IOException

media

public String media(String path)
             throws IOException
Returns a public link directly to a file. Similar to /shares. The difference is that this bypasses the Dropbox webserver, used to provide a preview of the file, so that you can effectively stream the contents of your media.

Sample of returned message (JSON): 

 {
    "url": "https://dl.dropbox.com/0/view/2j3mng7pmdqinf9/Apps/INFOMAS/digipub.jpg", 
    "expires": "Sat, 29 Sep 2012 19:16:20 +0000"
 }

This method wraps the /media service. See the official API Documentation for more information.

Returns:
The public link (URL)
Throws:
IOException

getThumbnail

public void getThumbnail(String path,
                         ThumbSize size,
                         ThumbFormat format,
                         OutputStream out)
                  throws IOException
Gets a thumbnail for an image. Default is a JPEG image of 64x64 pixels.

This method currently supports files with the following file extensions: "jpg", "jpeg", "png", "tiff", "tif", "gif", and "bmp" (case insensitive). Magic numbers are not used, so use proper file names! Photos that are larger than 20MB in size will not be converted to a thumbnail.

This method wraps the /thumbnails service. See the official API Documentation for more information.

Throws:
IOException

chunkedUpload

public Dropbox.ChunkedFilesPut chunkedUpload(String path)
                                      throws IOException
Uploads large files to Dropbox in multiple chunks. Also has the ability to resume if the upload is interrupted. This allows for uploads larger than the /files_put maximum of 150 MB.

This method wraps the /chunked_upload service. See the official API Documentation for more information.

Throws:
IOException

copy

public Entry copy(String fromPath,
                  String toPath)
           throws IOException
Copies a file or folder to a new location.

This method wraps the /fileops/copy service. See the official API Documentation for more information.

Returns:
The metadata of the file
Throws:
IOException

delete

public Entry delete(String path)
             throws IOException
Deletes a file or folder. If the file or folder does not exists, an error is returned 
 404 Not Found
 {"error": "Path '/testtest' not found"}
This method wraps the /fileops/delete service. See the official API Documentation for more information.

Returns:
The metadata of the file

IOException
